sources.title: You're Only Young Twice
sources.description: Title: You're Only Young Twice Summary: Ada Shore is mistaken for a new secretary, she brings a breath of fresh air to the traditional university. Directed by: Terry Bishop Actors: Duncan Macrae, Joseph Tomelty, Patrick Barr Production Company: Group 3 Release Date: July 1952 (UK) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 A young woman (Diane Hart) arrives at a Scottish university to visit her uncle (Joseph Tomelty), a famous writer now employed as a humble porter, who went into hiding during the Irish Civil War some thirty years earlier. The principal of the university (Patrick Barr) assumes she is his new secretary and she falls in with this. A senior professor (Duncan Macrae) starts a campaign to improve the morals of the students, and enlists his pompous son (Charles Hawtrey) in his crusade, with farcical results.

metadata.Plot: A young woman (Diane Hart) arrives at a Scottish university to visit her uncle (Joseph Tomelty), a famous writer now employed as a humble porter, who went into hiding during the Irish Civil War some thirty years earlier. A senior professor (Duncan Macrae) starts a campaign to improve the morals of the students, and enlists his pompous son (Charles Hawtrey) in his crusade, with farcical results.
metadata.Writer: James Bridie, Lindsay Galloway, Reginald Beckwith
metadata.Actors: Duncan Macrae, Joseph Tomelty, Patrick Barr
